Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

Imagine a world in which you can be detained by police and thrown in jail for taking a phone call from a family member. Or for using the same street in your neighborhood that you've been taking for years. Or for getting laid off from your job.

Pennsylvania has some of the harshest probation laws in the nation, with no limit to the amount of time a person can be placed under government supervision and a litany of technical violations that would never cause a person to be incarcerated under normal circumstances.

It doesn't have to be this way.

Today, the Pennsylvania Senate is holding public hearings to review the probation and parole rules and look ahead to what changes should be made to the system.

Take Action

Along with today's hearing, there is a bill in the Senate right now that would go a long way towards reforming our broken probation system by limiting the terms of probation and codifying clear rules for when a court can send a a person on probation back to jail.

Take the opportunity during today's hearing to contact your state senator and ask them to support S.B.14 — the probation reform bill.

The legislation has bipartisan support, but many senators need to hear from voters like you before they will support the bill. Contact your senator today!

Thanks for sticking with us,

Elizabeth Randol
Legislative Director, ACLU of Pennsylvania
